intro: Hypocalymma strictum subsp. elongatum, commonly known as the long-leaved hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pinkish to red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often forming dense clumps with a compact growth habit. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, dry environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand extreme temperatures.
